children.subject: Thank you! I guess I ll put math 110 on the top priority for now.  I have no idea what IEOR classes feel like and what they focus on in their optimization class. There is little information given.

I haven't taken 160 so can't speak to that but I will speak on my experience taking Math110 in fa18 and then EECS127 in sp19. 

Math110 taught be the basics of how to think about linear algebra in a more "proof based" viewpoint. Math 54 for me was pretty computational, and didn't involve a ton of proofs. 110 helped me practice the type of thinking that is common in linear algebra proofs and and further cover basic linear algebra knowledge. 

I felt that 127 assumed a basic familiarity with linear algebra proofs coming into the course (there was a diagnostic quiz in the second lecture that I felt perfectly capable of doing with Math110 but not capable of doing if I only had 54), and thus having 110 under my belt helped a lot. 

The first 3-4 weeks of 127 were mostly linear algebra focused (less on pure optimization), but I really enjoyed that because the concepts covered in 127 were stuff that was not stressed in 110 (such as positive definite matrix properties, Singular Value Decomposition, etc), so I was able to further develop my understanding of linear algebra and its popular concepts. 

Math110 was pretty theoretical/conceptual, so it was nice to learn the theory first, and then in 127 we learned some practicable applications of least squares and linear algebra. One example in a discussion worksheet showed how the median is a "robust" (in a quantifiable, scientific manner that you will learn) measure of the mean using linear algebra topics like vectors, least squares, etc. I thought that was so cool.

If you really like linear algebra as just a subject in itself (which was my mindset - it was the type of math that really clicked with me), then 110+127 will be an amazing opportunity to spend even more time learning about its amazing subjects. 

tl;dr: Can't say anything about 160, but Math110 was a very natural course to take the semester before 127. 

Caveat: I took 127 with Bayen and Ranade, this advice might not apply if you are taking 127 solely with El Ghaoui (though I think both Ranade and El Ghaoui are teaching in sp20 so it should still be good)

history.content: Hi, I'm a senior Data Science major and am struggling on choosing between Math 110 and IEOR160 for my next semester's schedule. Basically, EECS127, Math 110, IEOR160 are all within my domain emphasis requirement. But right now, I have 0 confidence in handling eecs127 for next semester. So I hope to choose a course that helps me review computational Linear Algebra and prepare me better for Optimization. If IEOR160 and MATH110 are the only two I could choose, which one would serve me better for that purpose?  Appreciate any insights or suggestions! Thanks!
history.subject: IEOR160 or MATH110 in preparing for EECS127?
